required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study to Evaluate Long-term Safety and Biodegradability of YVOIRE Classic s
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center, Prospective and Observational Study to Evaluate Long-term Safety and Biodegradability of YVOIRE Classic s Injected Into the Nasolabial Folds

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate long-term safety of YVOIRE classic s by incidence of adverse events including injection site local reactions and biodegradability

primary_outcome.time_frame: Until subject reaching total biodegradation criterion (WSRS change) ; an expected average of 2 years.

primary_outcome.measure: Wrinkle Severity Rating Scale (WSRS) change from baseline
primary_outcome.time_frame: Until subject reaching total biodegradation criterion (WSRS change) ; an expected average of 2 years.

clinical_study.condition: Normal; Healthy Adults With Extreme, Severe, Modreate, or Light Nasolabial Folds

study_pop.textblock: Subject who receive hyaluronic acid filler into the nasolabial folds

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age is over 18 years old
- Must be willing and able to provide written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Sensitive to hyaluronic acid or any excipients of study product
- Have history of streptococcal disease, severe allergy or anaphylaxis or bleeding disorders.
- Women in pregnancy or lactation

overall_official.affiliation: Shanghai Ninth People's Hospital Affiliated to Shanghai Jiao Tong University
